title: Strengthening Learning Design Competencies: Problem-Based Learning (PBL) for Enhancing Clinical Competencies of Hospital Pharmacists

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary pharmaceutical knowledge and comprehension of human physiology
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Analyze complex patient cases, including drug interactions, to develop evidence-based medication treatment plans.
Mathematically interpret clinical data such as blood pressure and blood glucose levels to propose dosage adjustment strategies.

Learners analyze three PBL (Problem-Based Learning) case studies and develop a draft personalized monitoring protocol for a single diabetic patient in five stages (problem definition, data collection, indicator setting, implementation plan, evaluation method), submitting a result that meets at least four of five peer-assessment rubric criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
